Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libgudev1
exit 0

#!/bin/bash

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: systemd bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The systemd packages contain systemd, a system and service manager for Linux, compatible with the SysV and LSB init scripts. It provides aggressive parallelization capabilities, uses socket and D-Bus activation for starting services, offers on-demand starting of daemons, and keeps track of processes using Linux cgroups. In addition, it supports snapshotting and restoring of the system state, maintains mount and automount points, and implements an elaborate transactional dependency-based service control logic. It can also work as a drop-in replacement for sysvinit. This update fixes the following bugs: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 introduced ldconfig.service, which is run during early boot stages before non-root file systems are mounted. As a consequence, links in the /lib/ and /lib64/ directories could be broken if remote file systems were not mounted yet, and the "ldconfig -X" command that was executed by ldconfig.service removed those symbolic links. To fix this bug, the ldconfig.service unit file has been removed from the systemd packages. As a result, the mentioned symbolic links are no longer removed. (BZ#1338892) Previously, systemd incorrectly handled the "LABEL=/" option in the initial RAM disk (initrd). As a consequence, the label was not found, and the system failed to boot when the root partition LABEL included the "/" character. With this update, "/" is escaped correctly in the described situation, and the system no longer fails to boot. It is necessary to run the "dracut -f" command after applying this update. (BZ#1340050) Users of systemd are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
